As I'm going through this I would love the option to add a css class or ID to a module in the styling section.
Also (i'm reaching) to allow for a selection of multiple class types for any elements in the container

I think it depends on the intended audience, theres a fine line (imo), but to me it feels that the CMS page editor itself should be quite slim, I don’t really want a client to go in and change everything to comic sans, 50px and lime green. Would be great to have some control over what user levels can do on the page editor
i’d be curious to learn more

in my mind, i think the ideal is more like a design system where there are semantic names for different types of components like a button such as “primary,” “secondary,” etc… and those are what a user chooses
and then those control classnames that change the presentation

Similarly. What <@U22VBL87M> is discussing would work. But for instance. I want to keep a more flexible DND area. But I don't want them to be able to add styles to the rows but allow them to use default styles that are defined in the theme fields.

EX: i gave a DND template to one of my marketers and he gave it back to me with neon yellow background.
My clients would DIE if there was that much control for common folks who are building pages.
Love the idea of it being open, but it needs to be able to be locked down to options that fit within a design system too.
